Southern's X416

text: Roselawn Funeral Home, especially Dennis Craig, went above and beyond what our family expected when our brother, Jimmy Dale Hayes, passed. Everyone was very kind, helpful, and showed tremendous compassion in our loss. I would highly recommend Roselawn Funeral Home and staff.

name: Susannah St.Clair
text: I had never known that our family could meet at the crematorium to see my mom off on her final moments as a family. That really brought some needed closure to a family divided. What I learned during this horrible time was so very enlightening and memorable for me personally. I soon after changed my will to ensure to incorporate the idea for my own family upon my death. Jasmine was truly exceptional and caring with the arrangements for my mother and the chaos of a family divided.  I felt during this difficult time she was listening to my wishes as well as my siblings even if they were not the same. She showed a level of kindness and understanding that helped me stand strong during the most difficult time in my life of losing my last parent so suddenly. Thank you for that and more.

resp.text: Susannah, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and professional care that is absolutely essential throughout this process and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight Jasmine's service in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need.  -Barry Campbell, General Manager

name: Gary Voketz
text:
Gary Voketz

Upon the passing of my wife Bette Voketz, Roselawn Funeral Home was very accommodating in all my needs. I had a pre-arrangement created 27 years ago which included all funeral and cemetery costs with a savings of over $6K, based on what the costs would have been at today's rates. The only additional out of pocket expenses were for death certificates and the obituary. Jasmine was more than helpful guiding us through the details needed to insure a lovely service at my church and burial. No pressure was ever made for additional expenses or purchases over and above our pre-arrangements. Jasmine was also most thoughtful in helping my daughter who came in to do her mother's hair before the funeral.

It was with a heavy heart that I attended two additional funerals at my church within one week of my wife's funeral. Roselawn managed both of those services and Jasmine, being present, made a point of speaking and comforting me at each of those services.

I want to thank Jasmine and the staff at Roselawn for guiding and supporting me and my family through this most difficult time. I never had to concern myself with any technical aspects of the service or burial. Roselawn walked us through all the steps with grace and dignity.

When you are faced with laying a loved one to rest, I strongly recommend Roselawn Funeral Home. You can spend your time reflecting on your life with your loved one while Roselawn attends to all the arrangements.

resp.text: Gary, as we realize that this process is extremely difficult, we considered it an honor to direct you through every detail with sensitivity and compassion. Thank you very much for taking a moment to recognize Jasmine and our team members, and please know that if there is anything else that you need, know that we are here for you.  -Barry Campbell, General Manager

name: Tiffany Marchand
text:
This funeral home has done 3 of my family members' funerals in the last 10 years. I'm not sure who helped us 10 years ago when my uncle passed away, but they did a great job.

Then last September when my grandfather passed away after a longtime illness, Casey was the funeral director who provided my family with care. She was so loving and comforted anyone she could. At that time, we were both pregnant, due about a month apart. I didn't deal with the planning process in these funerals, but in January when my infant son passed away, I knew immediately which funeral home to go to for services. They went above and beyond to make sure my little boy was taken care of and gave us the opportunity to get many momentos. Even though we did not use their facilities for a visitation or funeral, we still got the same level of service that my grandmother received when she planned my uncle's and grandfather's funerals.

We were one of the first clients of Casey after she came back from maternity leave and she was so compassionate and caring checking to see if there was anything else she could help us with and making sure my husband, daughter and myself were doing as best as we could given the situation. They will always be our go to funeral home for our family in the future for the love and support we got from the entire staff at Alabama Heritage. Thank you, Casey & Paul, for all that y'all have done and continue to do. I would recommend them to anyone. (Sorry for the novel!)

name: Bear Fire31
text: The Staff at Alabama Heritage Funeral Home does a wonderful job when the families have a death. They also help with setting everything up even when one member of the family has things done. Casey also make thing easy to get going. Larry and Paul are great with making sure that thing run fine when time comes to service and buried service.

resp.text: Thank you very much for highlighting our hard work and commitment to those we serve. I will be sure to bring your kind words to Casey and Larry's attention. We are always here to help the families that we serve, so please let us know if there is ever a time that we can help going forward. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Lesa Keith
text: The team at Alabama Heritage made us feel like family during the difficult “unexpected” passing of my mother Eileene Griffith. Certainly she had already planned her funeral; however, as a daughter who has never been into planning, the staff especially Mr. Henri Powe who I had never met, made our entire family feel at ease. He let us see her even after hours and when family is coming in from out if town, it was so heartfelt & never once did the staff make us feel like we were a burden. It was the small acts of genuine concern that I felt every time I walked through their doors. I feel I have to mention this , no one ever really wants to pass down this road & 30 years ago , I passed down this road with my grandma from another funeral home who referred to my grandma as “remains.” I realize there’s truth in a body being “remains ,” but somehow 30 years later, I still found it a memory I wanted to go away . All my grandparents , brother , most of my friends & precious students are right here at Alabama Heritage & I could not feel more at peace . In fact , from a lady that isn’t into planning , I’m actually thinking about planning on finding a place for my husband & I too ! Thank you Alabama Heritage for everything !

resp.text: Lesa, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Mr. Powe. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Linda Wright
text: This funeral home provides a very caring and personalized service with great compassion for the family and loved ones. It is a beautiful facility and they are open to creative ways to celebrate your loved one's life. In fact, Paul Booker is very compassionate and creative and is very helpful in creating exact kind of service you want. He truly cares about all of the families he works with. He learns about your loved one's interests and passions and creates a beautiful expression of their life. You will not find a more caring, compassionate, and professional environment in this industry anywhere in the world! Alabama Heritage, and especially, Paul Wesley Booker, are the standard to meet. They go above and beyond.

resp.text: Our team is happy to hear we could help you during this time and we appreciate your kind words. Please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you. - Paul Booker, Location Manager

text: Alabama Heritage did a great job handling my wife's funeral. Very professional, all the details were handled well. Casey Nail, the funeral director, is the best!

resp.text:
Richard, it means a great deal to our team to hear you say that everything was done well. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your wife, and if there is anything else we may do for you, please don't hesitate to ask.

-Paul Booker, General Manager

name: will brantley
text: Could never thank Casey, Paul and all of  staff at Alabama Heritage for the wonderful care that we we received when we lost my sweet brother and mother in an 11 month period!  We will always by thankful for the way we were treated!  We have also gained new friends during this hard time in our lives!  Love you all!

name: Lee
text: I cannot begin to say how wonderful our experience was with Casey and her staff this past March at the funeral of our sweet brother. I was dreading the process due to over zealous sales people at previous funeral arrangements but she immediately put us at ease and was quick to understand our desires. It almost felt as if she was on board as a family member! We also used their catering people to set up a luncheon at the funeral home after the burial service. This worked seamlessly and the food was delicious! The whole process was easy and noninvasive on all levels! Many thanks Casey!

name: Louis Carr
text:
Our mother's recent funeral service at Alabama Heritage (AH) was beyond our expectations.  Every detail was discussed with us and carried out to perfection. The expertise, efforts, and genuine compassion shown by the AH staff set a memory for us that will not be forgotten.  We had so many positive comments from family and friends.
Our mother would have been very pleased with everything.

name: Margaret Neely
text: I would highly recommend Alabama Heritage Funeral Home to anyone needing their services.   All of the staff there are professional, courteous and helpful.  They go out of their way to provide or help with anything that was needed.  I would especially like to commend Casey Nail for her help and service.

name: Allen Flintoft
text: Our family owns Flintoft's Funeral Home in Washington State. We recently had the opportunity to care for a family from Montgomery, Alabama. They need our help getting mom transferred home. We called a number of funeral homes in Montgomery. Paul Booker, at Alabama Heritage, was far and away the best. His kindness, professionalism and attention to detail made all the difference. He was exceptional! Thank you Paul!

resp.text: Our mission is to always provide impeccable and respectful assistance to those we serve, Allen, and it was an honor to work with you. Thank you very much for sharing your thoughtful comments with us. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: De'Shay Milner-Sankey
text: Professional staff and a beautiful facility and grounds. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Marnekia, maintaining the grounds and keeping everything beautiful and professional for our visitors is of paramount importance to us, so it is great to read your review. Thank you, and if you ever need anything, please do not hesitate to reach out.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Margaret Murphy
text: I have attended many services here and have always, ALWAYS been impressed by the competence and true warmth of the staff, as well as the facilities themselves. One particularly difficult service to attend was that of a friend who had committed suicide. From everything that I saw and from what heard from the family, the staff went out of their way to be available at all hours to answer questions or address concerns and to be professional and empathetic at the same time. They do everything possible to make a very difficult and stressful time as painless as it can be. Paul and Casey treat you as family--actually, everyone there does! That is the only place I will use and would recommend them to anyone.

resp.text: Margaret, I am pleased to hear that our team was able to make you and your family feel at ease throughout this emotional process. I will share your compliments with the staff, as well as my gratitude. Should you ever need us in the future, please know that we would welcome the opportunity to exceed your expectations once more. -Paul Booker, Location Manager

name: Darlene Kelly
text: This funeral home and cemetery did an awesome job of laying to rest my 11 year old daughter when she passed after a two year battle with brain cancer.  Everyone had such pleasant attitudes and they had my daughter looking absolutely beautiful. Thank you Alabama Heritage.

name: Kathy Norton
text:
In 2018 I had the privilege of meeting Casey Nail upon the death of my Uncle.  She and the staff at Alabama Heritage Funeral Home were very knowledgeable. professional and caring. In 2019 we arranged the funeral of his wife, my Aunt.  Again, I was very pleased. I highly recommend Casey and the staff to help you with ALL your arngements for your loved ones.
Thank you Casey!
James Mathew Smith
Kathy Ruppenthal Norton

resp.text: Your vote of confidence is amazing to receive, Kathy, as it's wonderful to know that you appreciate our knowledgeable and professional care. Thank you for your support, and please let us know if there's anything that we may do for you in the future. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Kathy Williams
text: I want to express my thanks for services rendered for my father’s funeral. Everyone was helpful to our family and guests. I found Paul Booker in particular to be personable, compassionate and professional.

name: Kenny Jones
text: Alabama Heritage and their staff provide excellent and caring service which is extremely important during a difficult time.

resp.text: Kenny, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us.  Your praise is much appreciated, but more importantly, thank you for giving us the opportunity to serve and be there for you during this difficult time.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Dylan Macarthur
text: On behalf of the MacArthur family I would just like to say that Alabama Heritage treated us with the utmost respect and compassion during this difficult Tim. Mr Greg Hollis was very thorough and made us very comfortable with our plans to put our Mother and Grandmother at peace .Thankyou so much The MacArthur Family

resp.text: Dylan, thank you for sharing such a kind message with us.  Greg and his team considered it an immense honor to arrange your loved ones service in complete accordance to your wishes, and are so touched by your recognition. Thank you again for honoring us with your kind words and please know that we are always here for you and your family.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Jaclyn Nicole Toole
text:
I cannot express how touched and taken aback by what I experienced at Alabama Heritage Funeral Home. From the minute I walked in the door I was taken to a level of elegance and service that I have never experienced at any other funeral home. Everyone from the staff to the maintenance crew were extremely courteous and professional.

Paul Booker, Casey Nail and their staff went above and beyond to help make my father’s visitation and service be a reflection of the life that he lived.  Many people commented to us that they felt like they were in his den at his home.  Words cannot express how they made us feel.  We were not the only family they had but they made us feel like we were. Their attention to detail surpassed any and all expectations I had.  They literally took us into their arms and treated us like family.

name: Lynn Painter
text: I had a some roses shipped from New York to Heritage Funeral Home for our friend's memorial service and failed to send a vase. I talked with the funeral home and they very graciously supplied a vase and included a card with our message. They were so helpful and kind and even emailed a photo of the finished arrangement . Many thanks for their support.

resp.text: Lynn, our team is happy to know we made such an impact, and appreciate you leaving this kind review. - Paul Booker, Location Manager

name: Kim Byrom
text: Alabama Heritage went above and beyond to handle all the details for my mom's service.  They came to our house to obtain my dad's signature on a form, so he didn't have to come to the funeral home until the day of the service.  They beautifully displayed my mom's quilts and pictures in the reception area.  They packed anything up when it was time to go and offered to help bring plants to our house.  Casey and Paul were a blessing to our family during this difficult time.

resp.text: Kim, we are proud to go above and beyond to meet the needs of those we serve. Thank you very much for taking a moment to highlight our efforts. -Paul Booker, Location Manager

name: Shamicka Green Charles
text: We held my mom's memorial service at Alabama Heritage. I love everything about that place. It was decorated beautifully, the staff was friendly and helpful; willing to schedule time outside of business hours to accommodate my siblings from out of town. They helped with every step of the process and gave plenty of hugs and kleenex. When I brought my toddler up there,bthey helped entertain him while we handled business. The director came up with personalized mementos to make the memorial special for my family. They had the repast catered so that my family was able to dine in the reception hall on site, without traveling elsewhere. Everyone said that the food was delicious. I highly recommend using Alabama Heritage for your loved one's services. It was worth every penny!

name: Carol Bridgers
text: Paul Booker worked with me on burial insurance for my Mother.  I was having a very difficult time with the company regarding payment.  He went out of his way, calling another funeral home in another state to help me get the information I needed.  I was very impressed with his prompt assistance.

resp.text: Carol, thank you for your kind words. It was a privilege as well as an honor to serve you and your family through these difficult times. If we can be of any further assistance, please don't hesitate to  call. - Paul Booker, Location Manager

name: Betty Williamson
text: Our family recently used Alabama Heritage  and their services for my husband.  All the arrangements were flawless, including transporting the body for burial at the National Cemetery at Montevallo. Everything was beyond expectation.

resp.text: Betty, we appreciate you allowing us to provide support and guidance throughout your Husband's memorial service. It is our goal to take care of the details to allow those we serve to pay tribute to their loved ones, and your thoughtful comments mean a great deal to everyone here. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Candace Bailey
text: Best funeral home in Montgomery Area! Paul Booker and staff try hard to make the most difficult time in life a positive memorable experience for families. Great facility, beautiful grounds, and excellent staff. I wouldn’t go anywhere else and my grandmother even bought a pre-need plan.

name: Rattana Maholan
text:
My mother passed away in December 2018 and my family was not prepared for her sudden departure. We were at a loss on what to do or where to begin with her service arrangements. All we knew was she was to rest by my father at Alabama Heritage. The Alabama Heritage staff were wonderful. Casey D Nail walked us through this difficult time and was an absolute blessing. Casey was able to compassionately take our worries away and guide us through these troubled times.
My friend also lost a family member in March 2019, and again Casey was the one who took care all the details for her family. We were talking about how wonderful Casey was to help (again) through our difficulties. Thank you Casey D Nail for being there when we needed you most.

resp.text: Rattana, it's amazing to hear that Casey compassionately took your worries away. Your recognition means a great deal to us, and we will continue to be here for you whenever you are in need. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Michelle Young
text: The spelled my husband’s name incorrectly on everything at the funeral-programs, the book,thank you cards, etc. They did correct it and gave me the corrected copies the day after the funeral but that was too late. They did give me a credit on the bill.  I understand mistakes can be made however, someone should have proofed the materials  so that didn’t happen.

name: Valeri White
text: Hoping they are working to put processes in place so other families don’t have to hurt unnecessarily. Names are important after the loss of a loved one and to have it spelled wrong on all purchased items is hurtful. It was corrected and brought to the burial site that was 2 hours away...but what good are 200 copies when the funeral was the day before. My sister in law also almost missed her husband’s burial due to the limo service being 2 hours late. Again, hoping processes will be put in place so no one has to experience this in a critical time.

name: Jennifer Lammon
text:
We had the best experience during this difficult time.
Casey and Paul were so peronalable during this, we felt like family. Casey came up with the best ideas for the service. The facility and grounds were beautiful during the service.

name: Alan Peterson
text: Alabama Heritage and their staff provide excellent and caring service.

resp.text: Alan, thank you for allowing us to be of service to you. Should you ever need additional information or assistance, please know that we are readily available. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Debbie Baker
text: I used Alabama Heritage for both of my parents’ funerals. We live out of town & they were so helpful with every detail. I would highly recommend them.

name: Makeitrain Raisins

resp.text: Our team is touched by your message of gratitude, Kelly. Thank you very much for allowing us to help you honor your father, and should you need assistance in the future, please don't hesitate to let us know. - Paul Booker, General Manager

text: The staff is amazing and cared for every detail during a difficult time.  They go above and beyond.  Thank you!

name: onedeadindian
text: Paul Booker and staff did a great job with our son Samuels "Life Celebration" service. Paul gave us an option of packages that they offered. He never tried to sell us anything we didn't want. We wanted something very simple and Pau; made it happen. The day was smooth and stress free. Paul answered all our questions and got all the forms need and walked us through everything. The day Samuels ashes were ready Paul had all the paperwork ready and simple he lead me to another room and had Samuels ashes presented very professional. This is the last thing we want to deal with and Paul , staff and Alabama Heritage went above and beyond our wishes. I Thank them for that.

name: Rick Burley
text: A very smooth experience with Casey during a very difficult time.

name: Jessica Hosea
text: I believe this funeral home did everything possible to make the transition easy thank you for your fair prices it allowed this family to lay to rest the loved one that was lost

name: Emily Coaker
text: Always professional and caring for the families

resp.text: Emily, from start to finish, we strive to provide support that is compassionate and professional. Thank you very much for letting us know that we are living up to this goal, and please know that your kind words will be shared with the rest of the team. We are here for you, should you ever need anything else. -Paul Booker, General Manager

name: Josh Holley
text:
This funeral home did an amazing job taking care of me and my family after our Father’s sudden passing. Casey was our director and she went above and beyond to make sure that everything was perfect  and that we were also taken care of as individuals. After we picked the casket  they realized my Father was too big. The only one that would fit was more expensive but they gave it to us at the same price of the original.

Month’s later a mockingbird (My Father’s favorite bird) made a nest on our family headstone. I asked that it not be removed until after they hatched. I went back a few weeks later and the eggs had turned into little hatchlings. This Funeral home takes alot of pride in having things done professionally but also accomodates to sentimental things that the family wants.

name: Carmen DiNunzio
text: Professionalism at its finest!

resp.text: Carmen, thank you for acknowledging our professionalism and please do not hesitate to reach out should you ever need us again.  -Paul Booker, General Manager

text: 1st Class Funeral Home

resp.text: Our team is grateful for your kind acknowledgement. Please know that we would be honored to assist with anything you may need in the future. -Paul Booker, General Manager

text:
I recommend you use a different funeral/cemetery service.

There's a large degree of incompetence with this group. Good luck if you use them.

resp.text: Chowie, as this is not the impression we want to leave you with I hope you will contact me at Jonathan.wheatley@dignitymemorial.com so that I may address your experience with us.  Thank you for reaching out and I look forward to speaking with you further.  -Jonathan Wheatley, General Manager

name: Jeff Carter
text: During a very difficult time for our family Oakwood took great care of us. Everything was prearranged which was the best thing for the family. Gene and his staff were excellent , they made us comfortable and at ease with every step . Thank you so much. The Carter Family

resp.text: Carter Family, our team is passionate about offering the compassionate and helpful care that is absolutely essential throughout this process, and I appreciate you taking a moment to highlight this in such a thoughtful message. Please know that you are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if there is anything else that you need. -Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: teri philpot
text: My family has been dealing with Oakwood for many years. Everyone we have ever met there has been exceptional. Jetta was amazing when my mom passed away and has been super helpful with everything at the cemetery. Alisa Sims has also been exceptional with the service she has provided. Anything I have had a question about or needed has been handled not only in a professional way, but with care as if they were a member of my family. Would highly recommend them.

resp.text: Teri,  nothing makes us prouder than hearing that our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to everyone here. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: Mr. David
text: I am so thankful for the assistance that Jody & Jetta provided. With such an overwhelming subject and so much information to take in, they put me at ease. They're very knowledgeable about the grounds and options. Thank you ladies, I appreciate your time, patience, and genuine concern for what we wanted.

resp.text: Mr. David, it means a great deal to us to hear that Jody and Jetta were kind, caring, and respectful at each step of the way, as this is our goal in everything we do. Thank you for giving us the opportunity to be there for you during this uncertain and emotional time. -Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: Peggy Tumlin
text: The experience my family and I have had were so wonderful . Alisa Sims and her team make us so proud to have a beautiful place for our love one . We have many family and out of town people who drop by unexpectedly to visit his grave and we do not have to worry about how it looks . My family and friends also have love ones in the Gardens and they also feel the same way . Thank you Alisa for making us proud to have this lovely memorial gardens in our community.

resp.text: Peggy, these are tremendous compliments, and I am thankful that you decided to share them. Please know that you and your family are in our thoughts, and we are here for you if you need anything at all. -Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: Paige Fitzgerald
text: My father passed away unexpectedly 6 weeks ago. Jetta was very helpful and compassionate during this time. She met all of our needs and made the process less stressful on our family. She truly has a gift of serving others.

resp.text:
Thank you for the heartfelt message and the comments regarding Jetta. There is no greater compliment than knowing we gave you a little peace of mind during this difficult and uncertain time.  If there is anything that we can help you with please don’t hesitate to let us know, we are here for you.

-Alisa Sims, General Manager

text: My parents prepared for this type of event, so when we walked in to Ridout's Chapel, everything was ready and waiting on us.  Gene Smith contacted me to give support and instructions for our next steps.  At or meeting Gene and Marcia McQuillan made the experience incredibly easy for my sister and I.  They gave us top notch service when it was needed most.  Thank you so much.

resp.text: Mark, thank you for taking the time to share your kind words with us. Many thanks to both of you!

text: My parents and husband are in the Everlasting Garden at Oakwood. I'm over come with a peacefulness when I visit their resting places. Mike Yates and his staff do a wonderful job keeping up the grounds.

name: Tina Stirnkorb
text:
A pleasure to do business with this establishment. Jody Stratton was very knowledgable, with a pleasant attitude. You have a great staff and the cemetery is always so well maintained and manicured.

Thank you, Jody, for all your help!

resp.text: Tina, thank you for sharing such a thoughtful review. We consider it a privilege to offer the professional and detailed care you describe, and we would be honored to attend to anything else that you may need.  -Alisa Sims, General Manager

text: I would like to say thank you to Jody Stratton for wonderful customer service, she took time to help me last week answering numerous questions that helped give me peace of mind.

resp.text: Angie, I am pleased to know that you received the informative and respectful service we strive toward from Jody.  Thank you very much for your praise, and please know that we are proud to be here for you.  -Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: Vickie Bannister
text:
This review cannot adequately express the exceptional person that Jetta Benson is - just know she will be all things to you during a time when your head cannot control your heart. From the beginning, Jetta becomes your willing guide, trusted advocate and sincere friend.

Even now, a year later after the loss of my loved one - Jetta remains in contact to express support - like I said "exceptional".

The staff attention is evident in the well kept grounds at Oakwood Memorial Gardens. Their attention and respect provides me with the peace of mind that my much missed loved one is at rest and will continue to rest in a beautiful place of remembrance.

resp.text: Vickie, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Jetta. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. - Alisa Sims, General Manager

name: rdt
text:
My parents grave....looks like a dirt road...my sister and i have repeatedly complained. Everytime they promise the moon on fixing the problem..they throw out some grass seed...or put up small flags. .each time it is half heartedly  improved it gets worse than the time before. I would not recommend this place for perpetual care and I'm sure my parents would be unhappy with how it looks. After so many attempts to have the problem fixed...i guess I take it public...
Very unhappy son

text: Very cool

name: Joe Manns
text: A must visit

name: Lisa Lacy
text: My father is buried there. My mother wanted him moved to be buried beside his son who just passed away. Highland will not release his body to be moved. I don’t understand how Highland can do that. They said it wasn’t up to the immediate family. They said nieces and nephews who don’t have any contact had to sign for him to be released. DO NOT USE HIGHLANDS!!!

resp.text: Lisa, thank you for reaching out and making me aware of your concerns.  Please understand that due to state law, we must have all heirs of the original property owners sign off on the moving of a loved one.  I hope you will reach out to me at Franklin.Foshee@Dignitymemorial.com so that I may address this further.  -Scott Foshee, General Manager

name: greg carroll
text: My family and extended family have used this cemetery for over 40 years. The upkeep has never been what it should be. There are weeds all over, deep holes beside headstones, and red dirt all over the place. I reported over a year ago about a hold near my fathers headstone and it still is not fixed. I reported it again today and they said they would teleport it Monday.

resp.text: Greg, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Maintaining the grounds and keeping everything beautiful for our visitors and those in our care is of paramount importance to us, so we will be sure to address this issue as soon as possible.  If you have any other concerns, please contact me at Franklin.Foshee@Dignitymemorial.com.  Thank you.  -Scott Foshee, General Manager

name: Cindy D
text:
Not good experience -
1. First meeting to prearrange (3/26/21) with Jacob was charged $395 for Everlasting Memorial.  On final arrangements (4/8/21) with Misty we told her we did not want the Everlasting Memorial and she said “Oh we are doing that for free now for families anyway”. Families, be aware!!!!  We would have been charged.
2. Spent extensive time with Misty on requests for the service.  When I got there, it was not done and I redirected.  Pictures were up on the screen which we did not want and our music requests were not qued up.  Their staff communication is horrible.
3. A relative had to call the funeral home before the service and tell them to turn on the video.  The video camera was not set up.

resp.text: Cindy, thank you for providing your perspective.  I would be grateful for the opportunity to further discuss your communication with our staff and the issues with the camera and music. If you would be so kind as to send your phone number and availability in an email to Douglas.Glasscock@Dignitymemorial.com I will contact you directly to address your concerns.  Thank you again and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Wendy Meadows
text: Misty Busic helped us through all the steps required to arrange my Father’s service.  She was very thorough and responsive to questions that came up even after his burial.  Thank you, Misty.  Our thanks also go out to Leonetta and Dee who were very helpful throughout the service & burial.  The chapel was set up with memorabilia far beyond our expectations - it looked terrific!  The round tables and brunch that was provided for guests during visitation was a totally new concept for us and most of our friends & family.  Not only did we like it, we received very positive feedback from many.  The only recommendation for change I would like to make is for the microphone volume to be louder at the podium.   For those who live-streamed the service, comments were about how at times it was difficult to hear.  I watched the recording and found it to be way too low.  Overall, my family joins me in thanking all involved for a job well done.

resp.text: Wendy, we take immense pride in ensuring that those we serve are fully supported in every way, and I am heartened by your kind words for our staff. These beautiful souls physically went to the hospital finding the right people, finding the physician to sign the paperwork, and physically mailing it. I’m forever thankful for those who go beyond a standard ‘job description’! Also I got to pick my favorite flowers that were arranged fantastically!  #awesomepeople

text: I attend my uncles service at Southern Heritage last week. Beautiful place and they did such a wonderful job. I live in Georgia and they did't do any of this for my father in law's service.  My aunt loved it. Thank you to the staff here for making such a hard time easier. Great Job!

name: Sue Watkins
text: When my father died a few weeks ago I was at a loss of where to turn. Southern Heritage was recommended to me by a dear friend. I am glad I entrusted Southern Heritage and all of the wonderful staff with the care of my wonderful father. Stephen was so helpful in planning all the details and getting the obituary placed in all of the newspapers. The visitation and catered reception the night before the funeral was so lovely. The staff that was with us that night was so kind and caring. Then at the church the next morning everything was in place and the directors were there waiting on us and helped us through the remainder of the day. My family is pleased with the way everything was handled by Southern Heritage.

text: Our family member recently passed away.  All the arrangements were handled with great compassion at Southern Heritage.  Jaynee, our funeral director, arranged a memorial service at the chapel and also coordinated a military burial service in Montgomery. resp.text: I'm delighted to know that Jaynee was very helpful to you and your family during this unfortunate situation, Susie. Your praises will be brought to her attention. If there is anything we can attend to for you going forward, please give us a call. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

text: My families first experience with Southern Heritage was 30 years ago when my grandfather passed away. It was so nice to have a familiar face guiding us through the process of planning the details of the service. I had known Bob and his wife Audrey for many years (going to the same church) and they were both a tremendous blessing to my family during this time. Seven years later, my brother passed away...again a sudden event and Bob was there to hold us up and pray for and comfort us all. I am thankful that Bob was there during both of these times for my family!

text: The facility was clean and welcoming. The personnel presented themselves with the utmost respect for the family and in a very professional manor from greeting us when we arrived, to us leaving. He truly showed empathy and solicitude. Although the arrangements were predetermined, Doug assisted in giving the family guidance and a little comfort by taking some of the pressure off of them by going through all of the available options of packages and even suggesting alternative ones, all while showing sympathy and compassion. When the time comes to need funeral services again, Southern Heritage Funeral Home in Pelham, AL will be the place I contact.

text: Great staff! Thank you for helping my grandmother when my grandfather passed. The Military service was amazing and he would have been So proud.

text: We were very pleased with the assistance we received from the full staff at Southern Heritage, coordinated by Funeral Director Bob Murdaugh. From the initial contact through planning the printed program, visitation, ceremony, reception and burial Bob and staff guided us through each step of the way and made sure everything went according to plan. Bob's background in journalism and graphic arts helped up develop a attractive program, slideshow and Memory book. Because they capably handled all of the details we were able to spend our time visiting with those who were there to offer their condolences.

name: Bev Peterson
text:
The staff is amazing. We had no clue what we were about to face when our mom died. We called the funeral home around 1am when mom passed. We were transfered through to  Doug. He spent the next 30min with us on the phone answering all of our questions and putting our mind at ease. The next day we met with Bob and he was wonderful. Our plan was to have mom cremated. Bob showed us that just since we were doing Cremation that didn’t mean we couldn’t do a service. With the help from Bob, Alisa and Carla we had a wonderful memorial service for our mother with her quilts, pictures and favorite thing decorating the chapel. We will never forget you all. Thank you SO much for helping us Celebrate our mothers life.

The Petersons

text: After our son-in-law died in December, we never expected to be back for our daughter's funeral six weeks later. Southern Heritage has been a blessing to our whole family. Nothing anyone could do could take away our grief, but everything the staff did helped make our experience much more bearable. It has been almost two months since our daughter's funeral and Southern Heritage is still helping us get through this difficult experience. We needed all the help we could get and Southern Heritage has been and is still a great blessing to our entire family. We are so grateful for the people at Southern Heritage.

name: Donna Baird
text: When my husband passed away in December, 2016, I went to Southern Heritage to choose a burial site and plan his graveside service.  Alisa Sims met with me and instantly put me at ease.  She is warm and caring, taking as much time as I needed to talk about plans and to discuss and look at plots.  I never felt hurried or rushed.  Alisa listened to what I wanted and made sure everything ran smoothly.  A couple of months later, I returned to design his headstone.  I took my small dog with me and he was readily accepted.  Once again, Alisa and the staff took the time I needed.  It was a relaxed and unhurried atmosphere.  I know they were busy, but Alisa and staff treated me like I was the only one there.  We designed a beautiful monument.  My husband’s plot is beautiful and well kept.  Alisa frequently checks on it when she is on the grounds.  She always makes sure I am happy and satisfied with its appearance.  Whenever I go to his grave, I always stop in the office.  Alisa and the staff at Southern Heritage have become an extended family for my pup and me.  They greet him with a dish of water and an occasional dog treat.  They always ask about him if I visit without him.  I truly could not have asked for a better experience than what I have had with Alisa Sims and the staff at Southern Heritage.

Everything was perfect and taken care of down to the smallest detail. couldn't have asked for better group of people to handle it all. Thanks for making a tough situation alot easier on all of us. Godbless.

text: We are very thankful to Southern Heritage for being so helpful to us. They made sure that everything was perfect.

name: Nan Galbreath
text: Bob Murdaugh was the most supportive informative patient person to work with.  He has handled several funerals for us in the past year and I have the utmost respect for him and his work.

name: Lauren Flack
text: Cannot say enough good things about Southern and Doug Glasscock. He helped us through the worst time in our lives. I am forever grateful.

name: Mike Sullivan
text: My son Jonathan Sullivan died in a rock climbing accident out of state. We contacted Bob Murdaugh about arranging his funeral and he went the extra mile in helping us, we were so thankful for Southern Heritage and Bob to get through this tragedy.

name: LuAnne Ross
text: Bob Mardaugh was extremely helpful with the arrangements for my younger sister’s service. My family’s desires ad well-being were of utmost importance to Bob and the others at Southern Heritage Funeral Home. They definitely made this difficult situation a little easier.

name: Bill Fox
text: Received excellent service from Amy Strayer, Advance Planning representative this week.  Amy was professional and personable; made me feel comfortable, answered all my questions and offered suggestions. I felt comfortable in purchasing the amendments to my pre-pay for my wife and for me. I was especially impressed by Amy's organization of the materials, organized and orderly presentation, and all done in quick time without hassle.  I recommend Southern Heritage and Amy Strayer.

name: Linda Haley
text: Jonathan Wheatley and Marc Wolfe could not have been more helpful at  our meeting 6-26-2019. They are a asset to Southern Heritage.        Thank you Linda Haley

resp.text:
Linda, I am pleased to know that you received the informative and respectful service we strive toward. Thank you very much for your praise, and please know that we are proud to be here for you.

-Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Laura Massey
text: Great Job! Thank you for your help and support with dads services.

name: Herman Williams
text: Every member of the staff we had interactions with were marvelous. They helped guide us through one of the most challenging times with dignity and compassion.

name: Lindsay Brand
text: The staff is wonderful! They take care of everything from start to finish.

name: alex eastman
text: Very professional and efficient in every aspect. Very much appreciated that in our time of need.

name: James Tarrant
text: They truly try their best to make sure you and your family are comfortable and well-taken care of.

name: byron white
text: This company has a very nice management and staff. Very careing people. I would use the angan if needed.

name: Tonia Contorno
text:
Our recent loss of my mother in law  brought us to Southern Heritage. We wanted her 90 years of life to be celebrated. We sat around a table and talked specifics of the funeral. Amongst ourselves we talked about her love of Hershey kisses and Krispy Kreme donuts.

The night of the visitation imagine our surprise that Krispy Kreme donuts were served, Hershey kisses were on the table, as were playing cards which were also her favorite. The day of the funeral they served soft mints, which I had forgotten how much she loved.

All of this to say they listened. They made it a special day and brought smiles to sad faces. Great job guys!

name: angie ulmer
text: Southern Heritage is a beautiful facility and has an amazing staff. Stephen Ulmer is very caring and treats you like family.

name: Jane Hutcheson
text:
I was at my parents grave site this week end to put Christmas flowers on their graves . I really became upset when I noticed that some type of vehicle had been driving over their graves and everyone's from one side of the cemetery to the other, like it was a road. I' m very upset with this and will be in touch with these people that operate this facility. They have no respect at all for my love ones or the other peoples love ones that chose the cemetery thinking it was ran very well ( at the time )   We have to go over there every spring and put top soil, fertilizer and basically that care of the grave site ourselves. It has been going down for several years now.

POOR MANAGEMENT

name: B Simmons
text:
During the very worst moments of our lives after our son died, Leonetta Prevo held our hands and helped us to make all the final arrangements.  She was kind and compassionate and helped us find a beautiful place to bury our son.  Leonetta has become a friend to our family and we are so thankful for her.  Many other staff members were so helpful throughout the process.  If you are needing these services, I can’t think of a better place to take care of your family.

The Simmons Family

name: Annette Mcleod
text:
It was the most horrible thing I have ever witnessed!
Things have changed ! Now it is like negotiating for a car. Bob walks in and then excuses himself to speak with manager, This happened at least 4 times.
"All of this could have been avoided, he says , with a prepaid plan. Already owning the crypt the still wanted 20,000.00 was still needed"
I felt he was pressuring us to buy prepaid plans now.
A cremation urn 495..  104 on Amazon !
Truly heartless and horrible day.

name: Phillip Hornsby
text: I want to start off and say that I couldn't have had a better experience then I did the day my mother passed and I met the people at Southern Heritage, I would give 100 starts if it would let me. From the first time on the phone with them until as recent as yesterday, the friends have been there for me 100%. I am sometimes not the easiest person to work with and my mom was my everything. I wanted something special for my moms service and Southern Heritage delivered. I first met with Bob Murdaugh and he was wonderful and so was Leonetta Prevo. They both listened and I don't think 1 time told me no. When I told them how much my mother loved Alabama Football and also her flower garden they ran with it. I met also with Carla Layne about the rooms we would be using. To my surprise on the morning of the visitation and service we had Alabama Football decorating the rooms and also my moms favorite flowers and even some seeds for us to take home of my mothers favorite flowers. You all went so far and above to make my mothers service so special and I can never thank you enough. You are all truly special. May God bless you all.

name: Jack Gray
text: Thanks so much for your help Jennifer!  You got me through a difficult time.

resp.text: I'm so glad that Jennifer was there for you during this challenging situation, Jack. Her contributions will be sent her way. If you need any support going forward, please bring it to our attention. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Jennifer Lollar
text: Wonderful people that helped us, especially Leonetta. Would recommend.

name: Trissy Cat
text: Amy Strayer helped me with the pre arrangements for my mother's prepaid funeral. She was kind, considerate and helpful. But what I also appreciated was that she presented me with all they had to offer and helped me make some decisions, but was not pushy trying to upsell me on services. Let's face it, funerals are expensive enough without people trying to upsell you like I have experienced with other companies.

name: Kendall Howard
text: I highly recommend Southern Heritage Funeral Home. Jaynee is wonderful!

resp.text: We appreciate your recommendation, Kendall, and for recognizing Jaynee. I will let her know about your kind words and please contact us if you need anything. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Elisa Ledbetter
text: Words do not begin to express my heartfelt gratitude, and that of all my sisters and brothers, over the sincere compassion and excellent professionalism of the our wonderful funeral director, Stephen Ulmer, and the blessing of Alisa Sims' genuine commitment and caring heart over the passing of our beloved mother! To walk into this beautiful funeral home once again after eight years since our beloved father passed, literally took all of our breaths away as my siblings and I were grieving and crying, but there stood waiting with open arms was so very kind and professional, Leonetta Prevo, who then kindly directed us to our own private room and introduced us to Stephen. Our parents many years ago had purchased the complete funeral package so as to help ease our worries and hearts when this time came, and Stephen already had neatly laying out on the table the complete folder of our sweet mother's wishes that she and our father years ago itemized all the way to which color flowers with dear Alisa's wonderful help! Every single thing was so patiently explained to us by Stephen and Leonetta. Great respect was shown to us by them as we explained certain things we wanted to do for our mother's preparation in applying her makeup and fixing her hair. We were treated with compassion and professionalism as our requests were honored and arrangements were made where promises we had made to our beautiful mother were fulfilled! Our wonderful team of excellent professionals were not only with us at our Church the day of our mother's funeral, but were also with us the evening before for the visitation making sure that everything was as we wanted for our dear mother! Stephen kindly moved beautiful flower arrangements exactly where we requested and remained to make sure we were at peace! Alisa unbelievably had more beautiful, baby pink roses delivered by a florist to Southern Heritage the very day of our mother's funeral and lovingly added them in the blanket of roses that was to be placed on our mother's casket! My siblings and I just cried at the absolute beauty and fragrance of our beloved mother's blanket of roses that Alisa personally saw to being so perfectly gorgeous! A million "thank you(s)" does not suffice for the gift of Stephen, Alisa and Leonetta to our family and to all the families blessed to have their amazing help, compassionate hearts, and continued support on this very emotional journey!  Their attention to every detail without pressure has prompted me to do just as my beloved parents and purchase the complete package with Leonetta and Alisa! On behalf of my family and myself, thank you from the bottom of our hearts for your kindness, compassion, professionalism and genuine care and concern for   your customers... you truly treat us as family! Sincerely, Elisa C.

name: kathy plemons
text: Bob Murdaugh directed my family through the worst time of our lives in the most professional and caring manner possible.  As time passes by we realize how lost we were and how Blessed we were to have had such kindness shown to us during this time of need. Southern Heritage in Pelham Al is very fortunate to have such a dedicated person to provide a family with guidance at this most difficult time. Thanking you always. The Family of Tyler Kell Plemons

name: Ricky Little
text: Their General Manager is great to work with.  Douglas Glasscock

name: Brian Lawley
text: Great peaple to deal with.doug will take care of you in the terrible time of burying your love ones.thanks for all you do..

name: epic gamer
text: My mother dying was the most painful thing I have ever experienced in my life and Doug Glasscock was amazing. I couldn't have gotten through that day without him and the wonderful staff at Southern Heritage. To ease the process he took me on a tour of the grounds to ease my mind and and it was beautiful. The entire process was easy and painless. My parents had prearrangments in place which I recomend for everyone. Southern Heritage's manager Doug Glasscock was amazing. I hope I don't see him again anytime some but when the time come I feel completely secure in Southern Heritage taking care of all of the arrangements.

name: Lisa
text: Beautiful location!  Friendly staff!  Outstanding service!

name: Timothy Morrison
text: I met some of the employees of Southern Heritage at a Chamber Event. Great People that care for their community and families they service.

name: Jean-Paul Bootier
text: Very friendly staff. Comforting in a trying time for the family.

resp.text: Thank you so much for sharing that you would recommend our team. Helping those we serve honor their loved ones is a great responsibility and your thoughtful message means so much to us. Please don't hesitate to reach out if there is anything else we can do for you. -Douglas Glasscock, General Manager

name: Tiffany Pettis
text: Whenever I needed a person to talk to, Doug Glasscock was there to help me through it. I work there many years ago and everyone there was always very professional.

name: Dennis Hodge
text: The staff and facility were top notch.

name: Mary Glasscock
text: Great staff!Caring family atmosphere.

name: Lane Hopewell
text: Attended a service Saturday for our long time neighbor. Great Job by the staff and such a lovely facility.

name: Brandy hyde
text: The staff was very helpful and friendly.

name: Dee Night
text: The staff is very friendly and inviting.

name: Lynn Alexander
text: The staff was excellent and very caring.

name: Whit Allen
text: Knowing what I know about this company, I am dead set on using them for my services!

name: J. Wilson
text:
I am so repulsed and disgusted by the way this funeral home has disrespected my daughter's gravesite.  My 44 year old daughter was buried at Southern Heritage in Pelham, Alabama on May 18, 2013.  I have had to constantly fight with these  people since that time.  I had to beg them to put sod on her grave; after several months they managed to cover the grave with sod.  After that a large hole appeared at the foot of her grave - it took them several weeks to fill in the hole.  I took my 14 year old granddaughter to the gravesite today (Mother's Day) to visit her mother's grave and we were horrified to see the shape it is in.  There was a pile of old discarded flowers in the back of the headstone, a huge ant bed covered the back of the headstone, weeds and dirt covered every inch of the grave and there are large ruts, which were apparently left by a vehicle of some kind, that circled the grave.  I have constantly called and complained about the condition of my daughter's gravesite and I have been given one excuse after another.  These people have a very flowery presentation and the graves that are close to the entry of the cemetery look good but they have no care or concern for the graves, such as my daughter's, that are out of view.  I would not recommend Southern Heritage to anyone.  I am very hurt by the lack of care and respect we have received from Southern Heritage.

October 10, 2018
The above posting generated positive changes.  I am not one to compliment basic expectations.  However, with the assistance of Doug Glasscock, General Manager, there have been consistent improvements.  The area of my daughter burial has been well maintained, groomed and cared for.  The area displays the respect and care which should be afforded a loved one. I appreciate Leonetta.  Her position at Southern Heritage is her "calling".  She is always patient, encouraging and comforting whatever the need.

name: Barbara Hudson
text: Wonderful place with a great staff.
