text:
(Translated by Google) Machelle is awesome, I love her.

(Original)
Machelle is awesome, I love her.

name: Tracy Mallette
text: Nice open pavilion

name: Bennett Atkins
text: Great experience at Pinecrest considering the circumstance of my father passing. Kelly texted and emailed even on her time off to ensure the eulogy, obituary pamphlets, songs etc. we’re just as I wanted them to be! Very happy with the way it all turned out. The day of the service they helped us hang a picture blanket for display right before the visitation started and folded it and placed in casket to be buried with my father following that. Extra time was taken to help personalize my fathers headstone the next day as well. Everything was very clean and beautiful.

resp.text: Bennett, nothing means more to us than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate and dedicated service. Being here for those we serve is something we take great pride in and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Kelly.  Thank you for trusting us to arrange the picture blanket and personalized headstone for your beloved father.  If there is anything more that you and your family need, please do not hesitate to reach out.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Robbie Brewer
text:
We have dealt with Pine Crest with the death of both my grandparents, and things went smoothly. However, when it came to my mother, it took almost 3 weeks to get a cremation done. To their defense, it did take about a week to receive a permit to do it, but this was after an entire week was wasted due to poor communication from April. Ken came in and got things moving and things went well until the end. The permit was finally done on a Thursday and we were told things could move along and we were left with the impression things would be done by the end of the weekend. Friday we got 0 updates, so I called to see what was going on and Ken was gone for the day at this point. After multiple calls on Saturday, I find out the cremation had not be done and would not be done until Monday.

I am not pleased with the miscommunications and unprofessional tone I received. I felt we were not at all guided through this difficult process and mostly left to figure it out.

Edit: Since Ken wants to use a response he just copied off a template, I very much didn't appreciate that he told me If I wasn't pleased with their service he'd be happy to give us a refund and we can go elsewhere. Because that is how you want someone to speak to you about the remains of your mother. Class act.

name: Lacy Taylor
text: My experience with Pine Crest Funeral Home was okay at best.  There seems to be a serious lack of communication between the employees.  I tentatively scheduled the services for my mother for a morning service and I was told that it would be no problem.  My husband told them the time we planned to have the services when he dropped off the deposit.  However when my father met with them 2 days later , he was told that the time we planned would not be possible and that a time had never been discussed.  They did finally give us the scheduled time we needed.  Also when my husband made the deposit for the services he paid them with  a large sum of cash, which they gladly accepted.  Two days later my father wanted to pay the remainder of the bill using some cash and he was told that they do not accept cash.  I do not know what the difference two days makes in using cash.  Never mind the fact that cash is legal American tender and I am fairly certain they are bound to accept legal American tender.  Needless to say they made an extremely difficult situation even more upsetting.  This company way want to learn to operate in a more ethical manner.  I do have to say though that the funeral director we had for the services was superb.

resp.text: Lacy, thank you for making us aware of your experience, as we care deeply about ensuring your expectations are exceeded.  I hope you will consider allowing me to discuss this with you, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com so that I may reach out. I appreciate your time, and I look forward to addressing these issues. –Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Judy Tillman
text: I was so impressed with Suzanne Summerlin that wrote my policy along with her manager they where  both fantastic. The best thing was the no pressure to over purchase. And the extra blessing was the beautiful building that they just remodeled with fireplace in the large viewing room and sitting arrangements in the smaller viewing room. I could not be more pleased and my family is so happy if they want  have no worry when their mom and dad goes to be with the Lord.

resp.text: Judy, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Suzanne. Thank you for sharing your experience with us and please do not hesitate to reach out if there is anything I can assist you with. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Markie
text: I visited two men that I look up too, Dr.Eugene “Sledgehammer” Sledge” & Sidney Phillips. It was a peaceful resting place for the both of them and their grave stone’s were amazing. May they Rest In Peace.

name: Mereau Tacon
text: Pinecrest personnel did their very best to fulfill all our wishes for the funeral and they exceeded our expectations!!

resp.text: Mereau, it was our treasured responsibility to honor your wishes. Thank you for giving us the chance to exceed your expectations, please know that your family is in our thoughts and that you are welcome to reach out for anything.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Sean McLaughlin
text: We were very disappointed in the state of the cemetery.  It was awful.  If my mother had not already owned the plot we would not have used the facility.

resp.text: Sean, thank you for bringing this to our attention. Maintaining the grounds and keeping everything beautiful for our visitors is of paramount importance to us so we will be sure to address this issue as soon as possible.  If you have any other concerns, please contact me at Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com.  Thank you for your time and I look forward to speaking with you.  -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Ash M
text: I was not pleased at all with this facility. The staff member assigned to me was startling incompetent to the point where I lost an entire day of planning and had to make rushed decisions. Insisted I come in for an in-person meeting and kept me there well over two hours. Had my family not already have something arranged here, I would have gone elsewhere. Just completely unprofessional.

resp.text: Ash, this is certainly not the impression we want to leave you with, and I am grateful that you took a moment to reach out.  Please allow me to connect with you and ensure your concerns are addressed, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com  at your earliest convenience. I appreciate your communication, and I look forward to speaking with you. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Penny Nichols
text: My husband passed away this past week and the staff was exceptional with his arrangements. We had a non traditional celebration of life service.  They converted the chapel area with tables and chairs, we had a live band, singing and dancing and lots of love and laughter. They honored him and the family by their kindness, attention to detail, compassion and professionalism. I  couldn't have wished for a better group of people to work with. Thank you so much from the Nichols family.

name: Lesia Ferrell
text: The staff of Pine Crest Funeral Home is more than compassionate: they take care of their families. April Condiff was extraordinary with us, as well as Ken Bishop and CT Jones. The funeral home has a small town feel in a big city, which brings comfort. Highly recommend!

resp.text: Lesia, our team was truly honored to be able to care for your family. Your thoughtful recommendation means a great deal to us, and I encourage you to let me know if we may ever be of further assistance. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Nettie Disalvo
text: My husband's passing has been almost unbearable.  Kelly Owens and her team were a God send.  Our family and friends have all said how the service was so unique to Paul, especially the more personal table celebration set up, rather than pews or chairs.  They went over and beyond, even with creating momemtos for all of us to take home to remember this day. Paul would rejoice in this glorious send off. Thank you again Kelly!!

resp.text: Nettie, thank you for sharing such a heartfelt recognition. It was our mission to pay tribute to your husband in a way that reflected his spirit, and it gives us a great deal of comfort to hear you say that Paul would have loved it. You kind message means the world to us, and I will be sure that Kelly receives it. Thank you again. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Evalyn Lovell
text:
Sat March 21..
Where are the recent reviews, all are like 9 months or older??
You don't seen any comments from the manager in response to the dislikes posted!!!
I was in the DIP location on Tues Feb 11, 2020 to discuss all of my pre-paid/pre-arranging that has been made over several years now.
I'm still wanting on a response back from them to get a copy of my my pre-paid/pre-arranging papers. I have been told they are being mailed out that day on 3 different occasions, 1st time was when I was in there in person, that they would have then mail out the next few days. Then March 2nd & March 12th. Nope I have not received.
I do not live in Mobile to go there in person. Yes I agree with others, things there are not like they used to be under the directions of the Luce family. New management! 👎

Saturday March 28.
Still waiting to receive my papers!!!!

Finally as of Sat. April 11, 2020
After numerous times of texting back and forth.
I have got my papers in hand!!!
Why it took so long I will never understand

resp.text: Evalyn, I am disheartened to read of the troubles and lack of communication you describe. I hope you will consider allowing me to discuss this with you, by sending your contact information and availability in an email to Ken.bishop@dignitymemorial.com so that I may reach out. I appreciate your time, and I look forward to addressing these issues. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: John Nichols
text: The staff was so kind and caring when our loved one passed. Sylvia and Penny went beyond our expectations. They made sure we had what we needed and was there till everything was over to offer support. They made this difficult time a little easier.

name: J Melton
text: My neighbor passed away somewhat unexpectedly and no prior arrangements had been made.  He was a Grandparent to my children and VERY special.  With heavy hearts his wife and I desperately called and had problems trying to plan his arrangements.  Kelly Owens SAVED THE DAY. She was absolutely wonderful, down to even sharing the same birthday as Paul! His service and arrangements were as unique as his spice for life! A complete, true celebration of his life it was. We couldn't be more thankful for everything Kelly did.  Marcy also helped and their touches to personalize the service were noticed by every single family member and friend attending. I will recommend any person or family dealing with a loss to contact them. Thank you so much Kelly and all who helped you, with our so very special Paul in heaven now 💕

resp.text: It was an honor for us to help you pay tribute to Paul's memory in a way that truly reflected his character and I appreciate your kind words. We care a great deal about meeting the needs of those we serve and I am uplifted to know that this was evident in your experience. Thank you so much for the time you have spent sharing your gracious feedback. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Victoria Dowdy
text: I just want to say thank you to Pine Crest they are very wonderful! John Tucker was able to assist my family through this tragic time. Thanks so much. We definitely recommend them because of him.

name: Sondra Douglass
text:
Our parents are buried at Pinecrest Ceremony. My sister and I drove from out-of-town to place flowers in the vases at each grave site. The vase on our mothers grave had been cut and mangled by the blade of a riding lawnmower when maintenance was cutting grass.
We made a report with Sylvia Ross and found her to be very understanding, thorough, and happy to resolve the matter. She offered to keep our flower arrangement and put them in the new vase when it arrives and place them on the grave since we don’t live in Mobile. Then Sylvia said she would send us a picture to show the flowers on the grave. Thank you Sylvia for outstanding service and personal attention!

name: Katie Everette
text: I just need to say that Pine Crest Funeral Home and staff are great. Especially John Tucker. He was so nice and very helpful during this emotional time for our family. Thank you so much.

name: Deanna Ladnier
text:
Kelly Owens done a great job helping me with rhe arrangements for my Dad. She jumped through hoops to make things happen in a short time period. Thanks and angie Sims was a great help as well she has done a great job for me on both my mom an dad
Thanks
Wendy Smith

resp.text:
Deanna, as we realize that every step of this process holds great importance, we consider it a privilege to go above and beyond for those we serve. Thank you very much for your recognition of Kelly's care, and please know that we are only a phone call away if you should need anything else.
-Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Robin McLain
text: For years there have been signs in the cemetery that there are renovations underway.  Well, it's been years since I asked about replacing sod, because a lot of the area is nothing but a mudhole.  I basically walk in mud when I visit my parents' graves.   It's a shame that this cemetery is allowed to decline.  I recall when it was locally owned by the Luce family in the 60s that the pond was kept up and there were ducks there.  Now the bridge over the little pond is over a dry neglected nothing!  I doubt there is any renovation going on.    There are pretty architectural features like the pond, bridge and little building - how hard is it to just keep up what's already there and re-seed or sod where people can walk without getting in dirt or mud?

name: Stephanie
text: Pine crest is such a great funeral home. John Tucker was especially so helpful and so great to our family. Thank you so much !

name: rymona hayes
text:
The staff at Pine Crest are very compassionate and provide excellent personalized service. Gi Gi and Kirk are especially courteous and professional.  My parents and a sister are laid to rest at Pine Crest and each experience exceeded my expectations.  So much so, that
I plan to entrust my final services to Pine Crest.  My sister's viewing and funeral service was held at Pine Crest and I was very pleased with the facilities.  The grounds are also very beautiful and enhance the community. I highly recommend Pine Crest Funeral Home and Cemetry in opposed to other funeral homes and cemeteries in the Mobile area.

name: Teresa Cartee
text: Theresa and Kirk have done a great job helping me. This a huge improvement from the last people that had the funeral home.

name: Teee Jenk
text: The staff is very welcoming, friendly and helpful. Which makes our process smoother.

resp.text: Tamara, we're honored to know that our friendly and helpful care made this process smoother for you. Should you ever need anything else, we are only a phone call away. -Ken Bishop, General Manager

name: Samantha Hoctor
text: Thank you so much Pine Crest. Especially to John Tucker. You made this horrible tragic a lot easier for our family.  Again, thank you for your kindness.

name: Jody Brown
text: The entire staff at Pine Crest exemplified the upmost dignity and respect during our family time in need. I would highly recommend Pine Crest as a final resting place.

name: Jennifer Brown
text: Pine Crest is exceptional funeral home. My mother was always pleased with Pine Crest because it was where she layed my dad Oliver B Brown to rest in Nov 95. The upkeep & professionalism of it's staff & providers are great to say the least. Having to lay to rest family & loved ones is never an easy task & it does require outside help Pine Crest reputation for making the task bearable & worry free is outstanding. Once again they accepted the task of laying to rest my mother in Feb 2018. We knew she would & is being well taken care of, I occasionally visit the gravesite where my mother & father rest in peace, I'm never disappointed by unkept, uncleaned & uncared for grounds!! I recommend Pine Crest to all, also proud to add my sister Theresa Young has recently joined their team, looking forward to a promising career! Who better could she work for than a place who's reputation, quality & professionalism proceeds it's self! Thank you for a job well done!!

name: Vaughn Brennan
text:
Have had a number of meetings and calls over a period of years. Always have had attentive positive service..
We are pleased that Pinecrest will be our final resting place.

name: Jeremy Hoppe
text: Thank you so much John Tucker for being so caring during our most difficult time. You are truly an amazing person.

name: Maloris Rhodes
text: Thanks Theresa and Kirk for helping my sister and I through this. May God Bless you.

name: Amy Walker
text: Gorgeous cemetery.  I love going here to see the beautiful funerary art and the peaceful surroundings.

name: Cindy Ross
text: I normally do not post anything negative and always try and see the positive in things. This is a different situation, my brother, Chance A Lane, and I have been patiently waiting for a bad situation with Pine Crest Cemeteries Funeral Home and Crematory to rectify itself now for 5 + months only for matters to never get solved. All funeral arrangements were paid in full a week prior to our father's burial and to this day, there still isn't a monument at his gravesite. There hasn't been any resolution here locally, just a bunch of empty promises and a lot of "I'm sorry's" from the very beginning. I would strongly advise if you plan to have your loved ones buried here, think twice before doing so. Would be happy to provide more details...

name: my opinion only
text:
AAA +++  Service.   I learned on Wednesday afternoon that I had to bury a person.  The family wanted the services done on Saturday.  I own plots in Pinecrest on DIP.  In a moments notice they coordinated services from Memorial Funeral Home and their cemetery.  Pinecrest staff took me to the location where the person was to be buried for my approval.  I was told that the vault would be delivered on Thursday.  On Saturday morning the Funeral started at 11 am at Memorial Funeral Chapel.  At 12:15 we were gathered at Pinecrest with everything in place under a tent.  At 12:35 everyone was ready to leave the cemetery.  Everything at both funeral homes had excellent service.
.

name: Tharessa Francois
text: Our family used their services at the beginning of the year and Kirk Family Services Manager took good care of everything during this time of grieving.

name: Jo Committee
text: Poor service. Had a pre-paid cremation pkg for father, so little care for someone already 'paid for'. No follow through to email papers to me as I was out of town. Once in town much delay for actual cremation getting done. Up charges added after paper work was initialed, and sent for remittance 6 months later!  Much advantage taken of those in grief and little help. Presentation of cremated remains was by a custodian

name: Daj Bee
text: The worst experience you could imagine.  Right from the beginning the staff seemed uncaring, unprofessional ,and inept at their job.  After setting up initial meeting we were given little information and left alone in the room for long period of time. When questions were asked, the answer was not known because it was someone else's job. however we would go over that later. Later did not come.I felt hurried and that the staff did not want to know anything about how I wanted to honor my family member. I felt I was taking up their time instead of receiving a "caring guidance to a final goodbye".   I had to physically visit Pinecrest daily to check on arrangements for my family member as phone calls were not returned.  NO communication was sent my way. I was not asked to preview anything, check on preparations, if I wanted flowers, if I wanted engraving. No one wanted to take responsibility.  The day of the funeral was further "salt in the wound" as communication among the staff was non-existent resulting in an embarrassing situation and dishonor and disrespect for my loved one. If I could rate Pinecrest less than -1, I would.  Years ago Pinecrest had a great reputation. Everyone could count on them , not now. We still have lots in Pinecrest, but lots or no lots, we won't subject our family to this treatment again. This is a hard time, no one needs to have added stress from someone who is supposed to guide you in a time of need and should show compassion.

name: Wayne Gautney
text: The staff was excellent, organized and accommodating to our family!

name: Sandy Catchot Rosson
text: My sisters grave is sinking n I asked them 5 times 2 fix her grave n nothing

text: Mr Davis dropped the ball. He just went through the motions. Could only hear 1 song of 3 chosen and got the wrong picture for the portrait. Never got 1 apology from him.  Was told the general Mgr would call and it never happened. Very little service after the big sale. Was told the funeral home would call after the death and that never happened. How could 1 person screw up so bad and still have a job? Was told he was the funeral director on top of all this. Please do not let this happen to you

resp.text: Larry, getting the special details of a loved one's service correct is very important to us, so I am sorry to read of your disappointment. name: Bryan Strickland
text: Heather Covington assisted my wife and me in selecting our prepaid funeral plans.  We both wanted to save our survivors the agony and expense of planning and paying for our funerals.  If one of us predeceases the other, it saves the other from having to do this planning in a time of sadness and grief.  We also realized that it is much easier to make these decisions when we are still healthy rather than when hovering at death's door.  We also wanted to limit the drain on our finances from the cost of being laid to rest.  Heather initially provided a briefing for veterans on behalf of Dignity Memorial, focusing on benefits the VA provides at time of death.  She followed up with two individual sessions with my wife and me, one at Alabama Heritage Funeral Home and the other in our home.  In the hours she spent with us, we examined everything that Dignity Memorial offers and selected identical plans--cremation with interment of ashes at Alabama National Cemetery at Montevallo.  We are quite satisfied with our plans and give all the credit to Heather for her selfless assistance.  Thanks again, Heather!

resp.text: Thank you for describing what Heather was able to do for you and your wife, Bryan. She will be made aware of her helpful contributions. If there is anything you'd like to ask us, you are more than welcome to reach out. -Sergio Cavazos, General Manager

name: Mike and Suzanne Outten
text: Our mother, Nell Smith, went to be with the Lord a week ago today; she was living in North Carolina with us at the time of her passing; however, since Alabama was her home, raised in Montgomery, we wanted this to be her final resting place among her family members who had gone on before many years ago.  Planning a funeral for a loved one, no matter the age (93 years) is never an easy thing to do; it takes a lot of assistance, concern, care, encouragement and compassion to get through it and we cannot begin to express our gratitude and thankfulness for the staff at Greenwood who helped to get us through this painful time.  We want to thank Michael Cox, Sandra Ragsdale, and Greg Hollis for all the help and comfort they gave us before and during this time, and we want to extend a very special thank you to Greg Hollis for offering and his willingness to officiate her service.  We knew the type of service we wanted for her, and even though he did not know her personally, we could not have imagined how perfect it could have been.  It was so much more than we even imagined.  It was a true testament to our mother - her life, her love for her children and grandchildren, our love for her, but more so, her love for her Lord Jesus.  Working with Greenwood was such a blessing; we pray the Lord's blessings on each one of them as they continue to minister and assist families in these times of sorrow, and we would highly recommend them to anyone who will be facing this situation in the future.

name: Demi Kleitches
text:
angela kamburis kleitches — Planning a loved one's funeral service is certainly the hardest thing I have ever done... especially for my mom, my best friend. Michael, Sergio, Mack, Sandra and Jeremy all played a very important part in making the traditional Greek Orthodox funeral service beautiful for our Mother. Their warmth, compassion and desire to make everything to our satisfaction certainly helped ease the pain at this very sad and difficult time.
Having lived out of state for over 26 years, handling details can be a challenge. Many thanks to Sergio and Jeremy for going above and beyond to make our plans happen. There are many traditions involved with a Greek orthodox funeral and I am so thankful for aunts and relatives who assisted with those steps. My parents are both part of old, long-time Montgomery families that make up much of the local Greek community. I was comforted by Sandra in the office who was so sweet, understanding and knew my aunt.
Michael Cox was an excellent funeral director and remained calm and constant throughout the process. He was outstanding at the church and ensured our requests. He lead an informative meeting at the family table to finalize  funeral dollars and expectations. Mack in "PCP" was such an easy person to work with, as three of us made sure mom's make-up and dress was just as she would have expected!
At 10:30PM after Mom's funeral, I realized that while there were lots of people in attendance, there were many friends about her age that were missing. Having the obituary put on the website was made very clear and that it was at no cost. That's great, but in order to reach more of her target age group the good old newspaper is definitely the best approach!! So many friends reached out when I printed the obituary the day after her funeral. They simply did not know mom had passed away. This leads to my strong recommendation for white-chapel to assist with actually contacting the Montgomery Advertiser and  with submitting the obituary. Of course we are responsible for the cost. I would encourage at least a small informative notice to persons in this age category. I feel there was definite confusion on that situation... at least for ME. Apparently I misunderstood exactly how the newspaper obituary operated.  If I could only re-do that part!!!
Everything else was absolutely perfect, mom looked beautiful and the flowers were gorgeous (thank you Michele)!! She would approve.
With the exception of the disappointing newspaper glitch... I would highly recommend White Chapel-Greenwood Funeral Home services along with their dear and assuring staff.

Many thanks to all!
Sincerely,
Angela

name: Art Of Valor
text: Great tribute to the brave individuals who lost their lives during the Palm Sunday tornado while attending Goshen United Methodist Church in Piedmont, AL on Sunday March 27th, 1994. The church took a direct hit from the large tornado and several people, including children, lost their lives that day. So nice to see this beautiful memorial erected several years ago to pay respects to the victims of this awful tragedy.

name: Danita Barnes
text: While going to a funeral and experiencing all the headache and stress the family was going through I thought to my self I will not get caught like that so I was introduced to Mr. Stacy Terry by my sister who already have preened policy.I spoke with this young man and with his knowledge I will be getting Preened policy through Memorial Garden in August.Super young man.

resp.text: Danita, nothing makes us prouder than hearing that a member of our team was able to provide you with such compassionate service. Being here for those we serve during the most difficult times is something we take very seriously, and I will be sure to convey your recognition to Stacy. Thank you for allowing us to be there for you and your family, and please know that we remain here, should you need anything else. -Stephen Ulmer, General Manager

name: Lisa Smithson
text: I wish I knew how they treated people and treats the grounds.  My father,  grandmother and many other family members and friends are laid to rest here and I DO NOT UNDERSTAND WHY THIS PLACE DOES NOT MONITOR THEFTS THAT STEAL FLOWERS OR ANYTHING THAT IS PUT ON PEOPLES GRAVES.    EVERY-TIME WE PUT THEM OUT,  SOMEONE STEALS THEM. YOU BETTER THINK TWICE ABOUT PUTTING ANYTHING NICE OR ANYTHING OF MEMORY IT WILL GET STOLEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!! If you are looking at laying YOUR loved one or a friend to rest here you better think twice.  There was also some other things that happened during the time we were working with them during my dads funeral arrangements.  RUDE and RUDE until I called them out on it.  THINK TWICE!!

name: Mildred Cope
text: Very pleased with services rendered by Stacy Terry.Awesome job!

resp.text: I appreciate you setting aside the time to express your satisfaction, Mildred. Please know that we are readily available to assist with any additional requests you may have. -Stephen Ulmer, General Manager
